xwikidoc.name: Beijing
xwikidoc.creator: xwiki:XWiki.Admin
xwikidoc.author: xwiki:XWiki.Admin
xwikidoc.title: Beijing
xwikidoc.content:
**Beijing** ([[/ˌbeɪˈdʒɪŋ/>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:IPA/English]] [[//BAY-JING//>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:Pronunciation_respelling_key]], nonstandard [[/ˌbeɪˈʒɪŋ/>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:IPA/English]] [[//BAY-ZHING//>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:Pronunciation_respelling_key]];^^[[[10]>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing#cite_note-10]][[[11]>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing#cite_note-longman-11]]^^ Mandarin pronunciation: [[[pèi.tɕíŋ]>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:IPA/Mandarin]] ([[[[image:https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/11px-Loudspeaker.svg.png||alt="About this sound" height="11" width="11"]]>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Beijing_pronunciation.ogg]][[listen>>url:https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/c/c8/Beijing_pronunciation.ogg]])), [[alternately>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_postal_romanization]][[romanized>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romanization_of_Chinese]] as **Peking**^^[[[12]>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing#cite_note-12]]^^ ([[/ˌpiːˈkɪŋ/>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:IPA/English]] [[//PEE-KING//>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:Pronunciation_respelling_key]])^^[[[11]>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing#cite_note-longman-11]]^^, is the [[capital>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capital_city]] of the [[People's Republic of China>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People%27s_Republic_of_China]], the world's [[third most populous city proper>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cities_proper_by_population]], and most populous capital city. The city, located in [[northern China>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_China]], is governed as a [[municipality>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Direct-administered_municipalities_of_China]] under the direct administration of [[central government>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China]] with [[16 urban, suburban, and rural districts>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_administrative_divisions_of_Beijing]].^^[[[13]>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing#cite_note-figures-13]]^^ Beijing Municipality is surrounded by [[Hebei>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hebei]] Province with the exception of neighboring [[Tianjin>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tianjin]] Municipality to the southeast; together the three divisions form the [[Jingjinji>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jingjinji]] [[metropolitan region>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_regions_of_China]] and the [[national capital region>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_capital_region]] of China.^^[[[14]>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing#cite_note-basic-14]]^^
Beijing is an important world capital and [[global power city>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Global_power_city]], and one of the world's leading centers for [[politics>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Politics_of_Beijing]], [[economy and business>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Economy_of_Beijing]], [[finance>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Finance]], [[education>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Education_in_Beijing]], [[culture>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing#Culture]], [[innovation and technology>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Science_and_technology_in_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China]], [[architecture>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_architecture]], [[language>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing_dialect]], and [[diplomacy>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diplomacy]]. A [[megacity>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Megacity]], Beijing is the second largest Chinese city by [[urban population>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cities_in_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China_by_urban_population]] after [[Shanghai>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shanghai]] and is the nation's [[political>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Politics_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China]], [[cultural>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_culture]], and [[educational>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_universities_and_colleges_in_Beijing]]center.^^[[[15]>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing#cite_note-columbia_encyclopaedia-15]]^^ It is home to the headquarters of most of [[China's largest state-owned companies>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_the_largest_companies_of_China]] and houses the largest number of [[Fortune Global 500>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fortune_Global_500]] companies in the world, as well as the world's four biggest financial institutions.^^[[[16]>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing#cite_note-16]][[[17]>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing#cite_note-Beijing_International-17]]^^ It is also a [[major hub>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transport_in_Beijing]] for the [[national highway>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China_National_Highways_of_Beijing]], [[expressway>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Expressways_of_Beijing]], [[railway>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rail_transport_in_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China#Current_network]], and [[high-speed rail>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High-speed_rail_in_China]] networks. The [[Beijing Capital International Airport>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing_Capital_International_Airport]] has been the [[second busiest in the world by passenger traffic>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World%27s_busiest_airports_by_passenger_traffic]] since 2010,^^[[[18]>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing#cite_note-ACI_aero-18]]^^ and, as of 2016, the city's [[subway network>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing_Subway]] is the [[busiest>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_metro_systems]] and [[second longest in the world>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_metro_systems]].
Combining both modern and traditional [[architecture>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing#Architecture]], Beijing is [[one of the oldest cities in the world>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_oldest_continuously_inhabited_cities]], with a rich [[history>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_Beijing]] dating back three millennia. As the last of the [[Four Great Ancient Capitals of China>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Historical_capitals_of_China]], Beijing has been the political center of the country for most of the past eight centuries,^^[[[19]>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing#cite_note-19]]^^ and was the [[largest city in the world by population>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_largest_cities_throughout_history]] for much of the [[second millennium A.D.>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2nd_millennium]]^^[[[20]>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing#cite_note-Top_Ten_Cities_By_Population_Throughout_History-20]]^^ //[[Encyclopædia Britannica>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Encyclop%C3%A6dia_Britannica]]// notes that "few cities in the world have served for so long as the political headquarters and cultural center of an area as immense as China."^^[[[21]>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing#cite_note-britannica-21]]^^ With mountains surrounding the inland city on three sides, in addition to the [[old inner and outer city walls>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing_city_fortifications]], Beijing was strategically poised and developed to be the residence of the [[emperor>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emperor_of_China]] and thus was the perfect location for the imperial capital. The city is renowned for its opulent palaces, temples, parks, gardens, tombs, [[walls and gates>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing_city_fortifications]].^^[[[22]>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing#cite_note-world_book-22]]^^ It has [[seven>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_World_Heritage_Sites_in_China]] [[UNESCO>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UNESCO]] [[World Heritage Sites>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Heritage_Site]]—the [[Forbidden City>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forbidden_City]], [[Temple of Heaven>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Temple_of_Heaven]], [[Summer Palace>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Summer_Palace]], [[Ming Tombs>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ming_Tombs]], [[Zhoukoudian>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhoukoudian]], and parts of the [[Great Wall>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Great_Wall]] and the [[Grand Canal>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_Canal_(China)]]— all tourist locations.^^[[[23]>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing#cite_note-23]]^^ [[Siheyuans>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siheyuan]], the city's traditional housing style, and [[hutongs>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hutong]], the narrow alleys between siheyuans, are major tourist attractions and are common in urban Beijing.
Many of [[Beijing's 91 universities>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_universities_and_colleges_in_Beijing]]^^[[[24]>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing#cite_note-Beijing's_Universities-24]]^^ consistently rank among the best in China, such as the [[Peking University>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peking_University]] and [[Tsinghua University>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsinghua_University]]. [[Beijing CBD>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beijing_CBD]] is a center for [[Beijing's economic expansion>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Economy_of_Beijing]], with the ongoing or recently completed construction of [[multiple skyscrapers>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tallest_buildings_in_Beijing]]. Beijing's [[Zhongguancun>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhongguancun]] area is known as China's [[Silicon Valley>>url:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silicon_Valley]] and a center of innovation and technology entrepreneurship.

location.name: location
